org.timepedia.chronoscope.client.data
Class Mutation

java.lang.Object
  org.timepedia.chronoscope.client.data.Mutation
Direct Known Subclasses:
Mutation.AppendMutation, Mutation.BatchMutation, Mutation.RangeMutation
public abstract class Mutation
extends java.lang.Object

Represents some form of change to the stucture of an Dataset. Typical examples are:

  • Appending a new datapoint to the end of a dataset
  • Updating the Y-value of an existing datapoint within a dataset
  • Removing a datapoint from a dataset

Author:
Chad Takahashi

Method Detail

append

public static Mutation.AppendMutation append(double x,
                                             double y)
Appends the specified datapoint to the end of a dataset.

Parameters:
x - The X-value of the datapoint to be appended
y - The Y-value of the datapoint to be appended

setY

public static Mutation.RangeMutation setY(int pointIndex,
                                          double y)
Updates the Y-value of an existing datapoint within a dataset.

Parameters:
pointIndex - The 0-based index of the datapoint whose Y-value is to be modified.
y - The new Y-value.

batch

public static Mutation.BatchMutation batch(java.util.Collection<Mutation> mutations)
Mutation composed of 1 or more mutations to be applied to a dataset as a batch update.
